champ.champInfo:
The general management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out Department of Youth and Sports of Zakarpattia Oblast and Family Department, youth and sports of the Uzhhorod City Council. Direct leadership rests with the Head of the Detached sempaya of the National Kyokushinkai Karate Federation of Ukraine V.V. Gidi (2nd dan, Uzhgorod) and the main panel of judges, approved by the Federation

The chief judge of the competition is Vasyl Gidi, judge of the national category (2nd dan, Uzhhorod).
Vitaliy Popovych, deputy chief referee of the competition (3 cues)
Isak Vitaly Vasyliovych is responsible for settling the teams
Secretary of the competition â€“ Judge of the grinding category Victor Garder (2 cues)

The competition is held on April 8-09, 2023


Competition rules

Competitions are held separately for male and female participants. Helmets according to the standards of the current Rules will be provided by the competition organizers. Helmets must be red (AKA) or white (GRAY). Personal use is allowed helmets that meet the above criteria.

  • Competitors competing in body protectors are permitted to use personal body protectors.
  • Mandatory use of white stocking-type shin and hand bone protectors.
  • Mandatory use of groin protection for boys and chest protection for girls
  • Mandatory use of dental protection (mouthpieces)

Children 2015, 2016, 2017

All techniques are allowed, according to the Rules of Kyokushinkai Karate Competitions. Competitors must wear helmets, body protectors, shin protection, hand protection, groin protection, hood Helmets must have a transparent plastic visor or grill.

Younger boys and girls (2013-2014, 2011-2012 and 2009-2010)

All equipment is allowed, according to the Rules for holding kyokushinkai karate competitions Competitors must wear helmets, shin protection, arm protection, groin protection, and a cap. Helmets must have a transparent plastic visor or grill. Competitions for boys and girls in 2005-2006 and 2007-2008 are held according to the European rules of kyokushinkai karate:

Allowed and prohibited equipment.

Age category 2007-2008

  • Blows to the gedan level are prohibited
  • All hiji strikes are prohibited
  • All blows at the chudan level are allowed only for the protection of the body.
  • Only 3 techniques are allowed to hit with dosed force at the jodan level: Mawasha geri, kake geri heisoku geri. All other Dzodan technique is prohibited.

Competitors must wear helmets, body protectors, shin protection, arm protection, groin protection, and a cap.

Age category 2005-2006

  • All kicking techniques at the gedan and chudan level are allowed.
  • All hiji strikes are prohibited
  • Only 3 techniques are allowed to hit with dosed force at the jodan level: Mawasha geri, kake geri, heisoku geri. Everything else Dzodan technique is prohibited.

    • Competition program:

    April 8:

    • 08:30-12:00 Weighing of participants, mandate committee
    • 12:30-13:00 lunch
    • 13:00-14:00 meeting of judges and team representatives
    • 14:00-20:00 Draw of teams

    April 9:

    • 08:30-09:00 meeting of judges and team representatives
    • 09:00 ceremonial opening of the competition
    • 09.30-13.30 qualifying matches in the KUMITE section
    • 14.00-17:30 Final part of the competition
    • 17:30-18.30 Awarding of teams

    Categories:

    • 2017: -20.0 30.0 30.0+
    • 2016: -20.0 -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 35.0+
    • 2015: -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 40.0+
    • 2013-2014: -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 45.0+
    • 2011-2012: -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 50.0+
    • 2009-2010: -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 -55.0 -60.0 60+
    • 2007-2008: -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 -55.0 -60.0 -65.0 65+
    • 2005-2006: -45.0 -50.0 -55.0 -60.0 -65.0 -70.0 70.0+

    Match time

    • 2015,2016,2017: 1 min, 1 min and binding decision of judges
    • 2009-2010, 2011-2012, 2013-2014: 1.5 min., 1.5 min., weighing, 1 min.
    • 2007-2008, 2005-2006: 2 min., 2 min., weighing, 1.5 min.

    Regulations

    • The difference for victory is 2.5 kg, or more according to the results of weighing when passing the mandate commission.
    • The organizing committee may make the following changes to the Regulations on these competitions in case of insufficient participants in some categories for quality competition:
    • combine or add weight and age categories;
    • to hold competitions in specified weight categories in a circular and mixed way.
